intro: Varronia lenis, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture. Its flowers are typically yellow with five petals and are followed by woody, capsule-like fruits. Varronia lenis is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in certain regions.
